items.sentence: Tom told me that he wanted Mary to learn how to do that.
Tom told me that he walked through the woods by himself.
Tom told me that he thought it would be safe to do that.
Tom told me that he plans to go swimming this afternoon.
There's only a slim chance we'll see Tom there tomorrow.
I don't think Tom knows why Mary likes living in Boston.
I don't think Tom knows who owns his apartment building.
I don't think Tom knows what time I'm planning to leave.
I don't think Tom knows what time I want him to meet me.
There's a good chance Tom will move to Boston next year.
I don't think Tom will be fired, at least not this week.
I don't think Tom will be as busy as you think he'll be.
I don't think that this is the best time to talk to Tom.
I don't think that it would be wise to do that with Tom.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary can understand French.
I don't think that Tom is the kind of guy who'd do that.
I don't think that Tom is in the mood to work right now.
I don't think that Tom is going to be a problem anymore.
I don't think that Tom has studied French for very long.
I don't think that Tom has any friends who speak French.
